name: pyrus-pyrifolia-chojuro
edibility: This medium to large sized fruit has a yellow to brownish skin with crisp, juicy white flesh. It is sweet and mild, a little coarse in texture. Great for eating fresh. It can be stored for five months. Ripens in late August.
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
fruit-description: This medium to large sized fruit has a yellow to brownish skin with crisp, juicy white flesh. It is sweet and mild, a little coarse in texture. Great for eating fresh. It can be stored for five months. Ripens in late August.
flower-description: The five-petalled white flower blooms in spring.
leaf-description: Green, glossy leaf is oval in shape, pointed at the end.
